meanings.sent1: The play had a satyric theme, with actors dressed as mythical creatures.
meanings.sent2: The artist captured the satyric essence of the forest creatures in his painting.
meanings.sent3: The satyric dance routine at the party had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a satyric melody, infectious and carefree.
meanings.sent5: The forest was alive with a satyric energy, wild and untamed.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a satyr.
meanings.sent1: His satyric grin revealed mischievous intentions.
meanings.sent2: The ancient statue had a satyric face, half man and half goat.
meanings.sent3: The satyric costume made him the center of attention at the party.
meanings.sent4: The old tree had a satyric twist to its branches, like reaching arms.
meanings.sent5: The forest path had a satyric charm, mysterious and alluring.

meanings.sent1: His satyric gaze made her feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The novel depicted a satyric character who pursued pleasure relentlessly.
meanings.sent3: The satyric jokes at the office were always inappropriate.
meanings.sent4: The city at night had a satyric allure, tempting and dangerous.
meanings.sent5: The dark alley had a satyric atmosphere, filled with whispered desires.
